title: Ukip's only MP Douglas Carswell 'had secret talks to defect back to the Tories'
text:
News Ukip's only MP Douglas Carswell 'had secret talks to defect back to the Tories' The claims emerged after major donor Arron Banks threatened to oppose him in the next election in a row over Nigel Farage not getting a knighthood Share Nigel Farage and Douglas Carswell (Photo: Getty) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Ukip's descent into civil war reached new levels of absurdity tonight, as claims emerged their only MP, Douglas Carswell had been in secret talks to rejoin the Tories. 
Carswell crossed the floor from the Conservatives to join Ukip in 2014. 
But senior Tory sources reportedly said last night the Clacton MP had spoken to Tory MPs to "sound out" whether he would be welcomed back into the fold before the next election. 
The claims came just hours after millionaire donor Arron Banks threatened to stand against the party's only MP in the next election. 
A blazing row has opened up over sole MP Douglas Carswell's failure to get former leader Nigel Farage a knighthood. 
Farage called for Carswell to be booted out of the party last night, in a furious column for the Daily Telegraph. United Kingdom Independence Party MP Douglas Carswell (Photo: Reuters) 
But today, Banks upped the stakes, threatening to stand as a candidate in Carswell's constituency of Clacton in 2020. 
Last night, Carswell - who defected to Ukip from the Tories in 2014 - tweeted "Knight night" as the story broke. Read More Ukip's 'knighthood for Nigel Farage' farce explodes as donor vows to fight party's only MP at election 
Banks, a man not afraid to tweet his mind, responded: "This Carswell tweet says it all. Ukip MP or not, I'll stand against him in Clacton next election." 
He later added: "We will have a high street shop in Clacton, professional agent appointed soon and I will be rolling my sleeves up." PROD, Nigel Farage (Photo: Getty) 
A government source told the Telegraph they had discussed with Carswell a plan to defect late last year. 
They said: "We talked about him coming back to rejoin the Conservatives at the next general election. 
“Douglas has been voting with the Tories anyway and will continue to do so, he's the only Ukip MP in the House but he's basically counted as another Tory already.” Read More Ukip at war as Nigel Farage demands party's only MP Douglas Carswell be sacked 
The appropriately named Mr Banks has funded Ukip to the tune of millions of pounds since defecting from the Tories in 2014. 
Following Ukip leader Paul Nuttall's humiliating defeat in the Stoke by-election, Banks insisted he should be installed as party Chairman - threatening to take his money away if Nuttall said no. Like us on Facebook
